result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Aloysius D Sartin

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Aloysius D Sartin appeared by video.  Attorney Haley E Wentz appeared by video for Aloysius D Sartin.  Prosecuting attorney Katrina Voge appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Hearing held via Zoom.  Pretrial conference held.  Atty. Wentz has received an offer and would like a status date.  Case adjourned to Br. 1.
Status conference scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Aloysius D Sartin appeared by speakerphone.  Attorney Haley E Wentz appeared by video for Aloysius D Sartin.  
Prosecuting attorney Katrina Voge appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm
Hearing held via Zoom.  Status conference held.  Atty. Wentz requests another status date. Case is adjourned to Br. 1. This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Aloysius D Sartin in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Hearing held via Zoom.  Pretrial conference held.  Atty. Wentz has not received discovery or an offer, requesting a status date.  Case adjourned to Br. 1.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Status conference scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Aloysius D Sartin
Current: 2742 N 34th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53210 United States  (Effective: 08-05-2022)
Prior: 2742 North 34th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53210

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in a manner and fashion as prescribed.

Defendant Aloysius D Sartin in court.  Samuel Tufford appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 01.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 01 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 8/5/22 @ 1:30p
